title: Global AIDS program targeted in abortion battle gets new home in State Department bureau
description: The State Department launched a new bureau Tuesday aimed at making the battle against global outbreaks a lasting priority of U.S. foreign policy, even as one of its key elements — a widely acclaimed HIV program — has become caught up in the political battle over abortion.

title: 'Oppenheimer' divides opinion in Hiroshima's Peace Park
description: Visitors to Hiroshima's Atomic Bomb Dome and Peace Memorial Park were divided in their opinions about Christopher Nolan's movie "Oppenheimer."

title: Protesters demand release of kidnapped U.S. nurse and child in Haiti
description: Dozens gathered in Haiti on Monday to protest the kidnap of U.S. charity worker, Alix Dorsainvil and her young child, who were snatched by armed gunmen on July 27.

title: 11 dead and 27 missing in flooding around Beijing after days of rain
description: Chinese state media report 11 people have died and 27 are missing amid flooding in the mountains surrounding the capital Beijing.

title: Chinese zoo's sun bear video triggers debate over man in costume
description: A video showing a sun bear standing on its hind legs inside its enclosure at Hangzhou Zoo led Chinese netizens to question if the bear was a actually a man dressed in a costume.

title: Deadly flooding strikes Beijing in wake of typhoon
description: Streets in Beijing's western suburbs were clogged by mud and inundated with floodwaters after days of relentless rain.

title: Haitians protest kidnapping of American nurse and her daughter
description: Chants of “freedom” echoed through the streets outside an aid facility in Haiti’s capital, Port-au-Prince, on Monday where just days earlier an American nurse and her daughter were kidnapped by armed men.

title: Myanmar’s Aung San Suu Kyi to be pardoned for 5 offenses
description: Myanmar’s former leader Aung San Suu Kyi will be pardoned for five of the numerous offences for which she was jailed for a total of 33 years, state media reported on Tuesday.

title: Two Americans reportedly kidnapped in Haiti
description: A search continues for an American nurse and her daughter after they were reportedly abducted in Haiti. According to officials, the two were kidnapped from a local non profit organization, El Roi. NBC News' Kristen Dahlgren has more.

title: Colombian president's son charged with money laundering
description: Nicolás Petro, son of Colombian President Gustavo Petro, has been charged with money laundering and illicit enrichment. Nicholas allegedly collected funds from drug-traffickers during his father's presidential campaign last year. NBC News' Ellison Barber has more.

title: Israeli prime minister defends judicial overhaul amid mass protests
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is defending his judicial changes after six months of mass protests across the nation. NBC News' Raf Sanchez sits down with the prime minister.
